data.title: Auction or Sell a Nobel Prize Johannes Stark Autograph Letter Signed

data.text:
FREE ESTIMATE. To buy, auction, sell or consign your Johannes Stark autograph that is for sale, please email your description and photos to [email protected] of Nate D. Sanders Auctions (http://www.NateDSanders.com).

Sell Your Johannes Stark Autograph

Consign your item at Nate D. Sanders Auctions. Send a description and images of your item to us at [email protected].

Below is an item we have sold in the past:

Johannes Stark Autograph Letter Signed Nobel Winner

Johannes Stark (German pronunciation: [joˈhanəs ʃtaʁk], 15 April 1874 – 21 June 1957) was a German physicist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1919 “for his discovery of the Doppler effect in canal rays and the splitting of spectral lines in electric fields”. This phenomenon is known as the Stark effect.

Johannes Stark autograph letter signed, composed on 23 July 1920 to fellow Nobel Prize winning physicist Wilhelm Wien. Stark writes at length about politics within the German Physical Society, likely referring to the 1919-20 decision to publish “Zeitschrift fur Physik” in addition to the Annals, of which Wien was then Editor. Wien would become President of the Society later in 1920. Two page letter on bifolium stationery measures 5.5″ x 8.75″ as folded. Near fine condition with bold and legible handwriting. With full translation. Sold for $1,860.
